details.title: Reliability improvement of Internet web servers through statistical process control

authors.affiliation: Fac. of Ind. & Manage. Eng., Technion-Israel Inst. of Technol., Haifa, Israel

p: Yefim Michlin is Senior Researcher in Quality Assurance and Reliability at the Technion. He received his Ph.D. in 1980 in Statistical Dynamics. He was Associate Professor from 1973–1990 at Tashkent State Polytechnic University. Since 1991 he teaches Reliability Engineering at the Technion.

authors.name: Y. Michlin

p: Boaz Sedan received the M.Sc. in Quality Assurance and Reliability from the Technion in 2002 and the B.Sc in Computer Sciences in 1996. He is currently a Software Project Manager at IXI Mobile Inc.

Dov Ingman is Associate Professor at the Faculty of Industrial and Management Engineering at the Technion and a member of the Graduate Studies Committee, Quality Assurance and Reliability. His research interests include element and system reliability, quality control, pattern recognition, information theory, neural nets, and measurement theory and instrumentation.

details.abstract: The proposed method, General Cross-Correlation Process Control (GCCPC), is intended for timely detection of hacker attacks and faults, before they become critical and disrupt the normal activity of a web server. It is based on observation of the correlations between the variables measured in the course of server activity. Some of the stronger of these correlations undergo drastic weakening at the onset of faults. A methodology is presented for choice of the variables to be observed, and of the monitoring parameters. To be noted are the robustness of the method, and the low cost of installation and maintenance of the system. Recommendations are given on real-world implementation of the method, as a basis for an automated protection system.
